cs.RO, cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper presents a simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) algorithm based on radio signals and association of specular multipath components (MPCs) with geometric features. The algorithm is designed for indoor scenarios where localization from radio signals is challenging due to diffuse multipath propagation and unknown MPC-feature association. The paper proposes a Bayesian model of the SLAM problem including the unknown MPC-VA association and represents this model by a factor graph, which enables the use of the belief propagation (BP) scheme for efficient marginalization of the joint posterior distribution. The paper also proposes a probabilistic MPC-VA association and a random finite set model for improved initialization of new VA positions. Based on these features, the paper is likely to belong to the following arXiv CS sub-categories: 

1. cs.RO (Robotics): The paper presents a SLAM algorithm for mobile agents in indoor scenarios, which is a core topic in robotics. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper proposes a Bayesian model of the SLAM problem and uses the BP scheme for efficient marginalization of the joint posterior distribution, which are core topics in information theory. 
3. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper is based on radio signals and proposes a probabilistic MPC-VA association, which are relevant to networking and internet architecture.
